meanings.definition: To make something old-fashioned or obsolete.
meanings.sent1: She is outmoding her wardrobe by donating all her outdated clothes.
meanings.sent2: Technology is constantly outmoding older models with new and improved versions.
meanings.sent3: The fashion police joked that her outfit was outmoding the 80s.
meanings.sent4: His innovative ideas are outmoding traditional methods in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The rapid advancements in technology are outmoding our current systems at an alarming rate.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming outdated or no longer in use.
meanings.sent1: The outmoding of flip phones was inevitable with the rise of smartphones.
meanings.sent2: The outmoding of VHS tapes by DVDs revolutionized the home entertainment industry.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed artifacts that showcased the outmoding of ancient tools.
meanings.sent4: The outmoding of typewriters symbolizes the shift towards digital communication.
meanings.sent5: The outmoding of traditional farming practices highlights the need for sustainable agriculture.
